title: Summer seafood stew with parsley lemon pesto

ingredients.item: 200g firm white fish fillet, such as cod or brill, cubed
150g frozen essential Waitrose Cooked Seafood Selection, defrosted according to pack instructions
200g frozen raw peeled prawns, defrosted according to pack instructions
200g frozen scallops, defrosted according to pack instructions

instructions.step: Heat the oil in a medium pan, and cook the onion, celery and carrot together for 5 minutes until softened. Add the garlic, bay leaves and saffron, and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the chopped tomatoes, fish stock and wine. Bring to the boil and simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the pesto. Place all the pesto ingredients in a blender and pulse to make a thick paste. Season and set aside.

Add the cubed cod to the pan. Simmer gently for 3-4 minutes, then add the seafood, bring to the boil and simmer for a couple of minutes until everything is cooked through and piping hot. Check the seasoning and discard the bay leaves.
Serve the stew in warmed bowls with a spoonful of the pesto on top, along with salad and chunks of good Italian bread such as focaccia.
